ignore.reason: Because this book is a compilation of two separate books, each with its own set of front matter, so it makes no sense to put a halftitlepage between Lavengro’s front matter and the body text of that book.
False positive on “Nor”, which is Scots for “North”.

Lint is flagging whole very long book titles which include punctuation, so these are “independent clauses”.
Lint is flagging instances where the glossary definition starts with the abbreviation “i.q.”. This should not be capitalized, but nor is it a continuation.
